verses.kjv: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.
verses.web: But false prophets also arose among the people, as false teachers will also be among you, who will secretly bring in destructive heresies, denying even the Master who bought them, bringing on themselves swift destruction.
verses.ct: Just as there were false prophets among God's people in the past, there will also be false teachers among you. They will secretly introduce destructive heresies, even denying the Lord who bought them — and in doing so, they will bring swift destruction on themselves.

verses.kjv: And many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.
verses.web: Many will follow their immoral ways, and as a result, the way of the truth will be maligned.
verses.ct: Many people will follow their shameful ways, and because of them, the way of truth will be slandered.

verses.kjv: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.
verses.web: In covetousness they will exploit you with deceptive words: whose sentence now from of old doesn’t linger, and their destruction will not slumber.
verses.ct: Driven by greed, these teachers will exploit you with made-up stories. But their judgment was pronounced long ago, and their destruction is not sleeping.

verses.kjv: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but cast them down to hell, and delivered them into chains of darkness, to be reserved unto judgment;
verses.web: For if God didn’t spare angels when they sinned, but cast them down to Tartarus, and committed them to pits of darkness to be reserved for judgment;
verses.ct: After all, God didn't spare the angels who sinned. He threw them into hell and locked them in chains of darkness, holding them there until the day of judgment.

verses.kjv: And spared not the old world, but saved Noah the eighth person, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;
verses.web: and didn’t spare the ancient world, but preserved Noah with seven others, a preacher of righteousness, when he brought a flood on the world of the ungodly;
verses.ct: He didn't spare the ancient world either. He sent a flood to destroy the ungodly, but he protected Noah — a preacher of righteousness — along with 7 others.

verses.kjv: And turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemned them with an overthrow, making them an ensample unto those that after should live ungodly;
verses.web: and turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them to destruction, having made them an example to those who would live in an ungodly way;
verses.ct: He reduced the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to ashes, condemning them to total destruction as a warning to anyone who would choose to live an ungodly life.

verses.kjv: And delivered just Lot, vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked:
verses.web: and delivered righteous Lot, who was very distressed by the lustful life of the wicked
verses.ct: But he rescued Lot, a righteous man who was deeply troubled by the disgusting behavior of the wicked people around him.

verses.kjv: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds;)
verses.web: (for that righteous man dwelling among them was tormented in his righteous soul from day to day with seeing and hearing lawless deeds):
verses.ct: (Living among them day after day, that righteous man was tormented in his soul by the lawless things he saw and heard.)

verses.kjv: The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished:
verses.web: the Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation and to keep the unrighteous under punishment for the day of judgment,
verses.ct: So the Lord knows how to rescue godly people from their trials, and he knows how to hold the unrighteous for punishment on the day of judgment —

verses.kjv: But chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government. Presumptuous are they, selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.
verses.web: but chiefly those who walk after the flesh in the lust of defilement and despise authority. Daring, self-willed, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignitaries;
verses.ct: especially those who chase after corrupt desires and despise authority. These people are bold and arrogant, not even afraid to insult powerful spiritual beings.

verses.kjv: Whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.
verses.web: whereas angels, though greater in might and power, don’t bring a railing judgment against them before the Lord.
verses.ct: Yet even angels, who are far greater in power and strength, don't bring insulting accusations against such beings before the Lord.

verses.kjv: But these, as natural brute beasts, made to be taken and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they understand not; and shall utterly perish in their own corruption;
verses.web: But these, as unreasoning creatures, born natural animals to be taken and destroyed, speaking evil in matters about which they are ignorant, will in their destroying surely be destroyed,
verses.ct: But these false teachers are like mindless animals, creatures of pure instinct born only to be caught and killed. They mock things they don't understand, and they will be destroyed right along with their own corruption.

verses.kjv: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;
verses.web: receiving the wages of unrighteousness; people who count it pleasure to revel in the daytime, spots and defects, reveling in their deceit while they feast with you;
verses.ct: They will be paid back for the harm they've caused. They consider it a pleasure to party in broad daylight. They are stains and blemishes among you, reveling in their deception even while they sit at your tables and eat with you.

verses.kjv: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:
verses.web: having eyes full of adultery, and who can’t cease from sin; enticing unsettled souls; having a heart trained in greed; children of cursing;
verses.ct: Their eyes are always looking for adultery, and they never stop sinning. They lure in people whose faith is unstable. Their hearts are well-trained in greed. They are people living under a curse.

verses.kjv: Which have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray, following the way of Balaam the son of Bosor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness;
verses.web: forsaking the right way, they went astray, having followed the way of Balaam the son of Beor, who loved the wages of wrongdoing;
verses.ct: They've abandoned the right path and wandered off, following the example of Balaam son of Bosor, who loved getting paid for doing wrong.

verses.kjv: But was rebuked for his iniquity: the dumb ass speaking with man’s voice forbad the madness of the prophet.
verses.web: but he was rebuked for his own disobedience. A mute donkey spoke with a man’s voice and stopped the madness of the prophet.
verses.ct: But Balaam was called out for his sin — a donkey that couldn't speak opened its mouth and talked with a human voice, putting a stop to the prophet's madness.

verses.kjv: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried with a tempest; to whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.
verses.web: These are wells without water, clouds driven by a storm; for whom the blackness of darkness has been reserved forever.
verses.ct: These false teachers are springs with no water and clouds blown around by a violent storm. The deepest darkness has been reserved for them forever.

verses.kjv: For when they speak great swelling words of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, through much wantonness, those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.
verses.web: For, uttering great swelling words of emptiness, they entice in the lusts of the flesh, by licentiousness, those who are indeed escaping from those who live in error;
verses.ct: They use big, impressive-sounding words that are completely empty, and they lure people back in through sinful desires and wild living — people who had barely escaped from those who live in deception.

verses.kjv: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he brought in bondage.
verses.web: promising them liberty, while they themselves are bondservants of corruption; for a man is brought into bondage by whoever overcomes him.
verses.ct: They promise freedom, but they themselves are slaves to corruption. Because whatever masters you is what enslaves you.

verses.kjv: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.
verses.web: For if, after they have escaped the defilement of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in it and overcome, the last state has become worse for them than the first.
verses.ct: If people escape the filth of this world by coming to know the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, but then get tangled up in it again and are overpowered by it, they end up worse off than they were before.

verses.kjv: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after they have known it, to turn from the holy commandment delivered unto them.
verses.web: For it would be better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than after knowing it, to turn back from the holy commandment delivered to them.
verses.ct: It would have been better for them never to have known the way of righteousness than to know it and then turn their backs on the holy commandment that was given to them.

verses.kjv: But it is happened unto them according to the true proverb, The dog is turned to his own vomit again; and the sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire.
verses.web: But it has happened to them according to the true proverb, “The dog turns to his own vomit again,” and “the sow that has washed to wallowing in the mire.”
verses.ct: What happened to them proves the old proverbs true: "A dog returns to its own vomit," and "A pig that's been washed goes right back to rolling in the mud."
